remarks: The scalar product of the identity polynomial matrix with a polynomial is a polynomial matrix.  (Contributed by AV, 2-Nov-2019.)  (Revised by AV, 4-Dec-2019.)
statement:
1pmatscmul.p $e |- P = ( Poly1 ` R ) $.
1pmatscmul.c $e |- C = ( N Mat P ) $.
1pmatscmul.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
1pmatscmul.e $e |- E = ( Base ` P ) $.
1pmatscmul.m $e |- .* = ( .s ` C ) $.
1pmatscmul.1 $e |- .1. = ( 1r ` C ) $.
1pmatscmul $p |- ( ( N e. Fin /\ R e. Ring /\ Q e. E ) -> ( Q .* .1. ) e. B ) $.
